segment.source: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior
segment.target: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior

segment.source: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior
segment.target: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior

segment.source: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior
segment.target: How to Configure Shortcut and File Type Association Behavior

segment.source: Shortcut and File Type Association (FTA) publishing policy is defined and controlled by the publishing XML file, which is sent to clients by a publishing server during a publishing refresh operation.
segment.target: Shortcut and File Type Association (FTA) publishing policy is defined and controlled by the publishing XML file, which is sent to clients by a publishing server during a publishing refresh operation.

segment.source: When the client receives this information, it adds any newly published data about applications such as the icons and FTAs.
segment.target: When the client receives this information, it adds any newly published data about applications such as the icons and FTAs.

segment.source: Then, it removes any outdated publishing data.
segment.target: Then, it removes any outdated publishing data.

segment.source: In App-V version 4.6, two registry key values have been defined to enable administrators to control this behavior.
segment.target: In App-V version 4.6, two registry key values have been defined to enable administrators to control this behavior.

segment.source: By default, shortcuts that are created locally by using the client console are now retained.
segment.target: By default, shortcuts that are created locally by using the client console are now retained.

segment.source: How to Change Shortcut and FTA Behavior
segment.target: How to Change Shortcut and FTA Behavior

segment.source: Two new DWORD registry values have been defined for the client Configuration registry key, “FileTypePolicy” and “ShortcutPolicy”.
segment.target: Two new DWORD registry values have been defined for the client Configuration registry key, “FileTypePolicy” and “ShortcutPolicy”.

segment.source: These DWORD registry values are not present by default, but they can be added manually.
segment.target: These DWORD registry values are not present by default, but they can be added manually.

segment.source: The Configuration registry key is located at HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5ClientConfiguration.
segment.target: The Configuration registry key is located at HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREWow6432NodeMicrosoftSoftGrid4.5ClientConfiguration.

segment.source: There are four policy values defined in the following table and these apply to both registry key values.
segment.target: There are four policy values defined in the following table and these apply to both registry key values.

segment.source: The following list shows the numeric values for the registry settings, and the behavior applied to file types or shortcuts on a publishing refresh operation.
segment.target: The following list shows the numeric values for the registry settings, and the behavior applied to file types or shortcuts on a publishing refresh operation.

segment.source: Name
segment.target: Name

segment.source: Type
segment.target: Type

segment.source: Data (Examples)
segment.target: Data (Examples)

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: FileTypePolicy
segment.target: FileTypePolicy

segment.source: DWORD
segment.target: DWORD

segment.source: Default=0x2 (App-V 4.6)
segment.target: Default=0x2 (App-V 4.6)

segment.source: (0x0) – “ClientOnly”- remove any existing items from the same publishing information source, and keep only items that are added locally
segment.target: (0x0) – “ClientOnly”- remove any existing items from the same publishing information source, and keep only items that are added locally

segment.source: (0x1) – “ServerOnly” - remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source and any items that are added locally, and add the new items
segment.target: (0x1) – “ServerOnly” - remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source and any items that are added locally, and add the new items

segment.source: (0x2) – “ClientAndServer”- remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source, keep items added locally, and add the new items (default if not present for App-V 4.6)
segment.target: (0x2) – “ClientAndServer”- remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source, keep items added locally, and add the new items (default if not present for App-V 4.6)

segment.source: (0x3) – “NoChange” - make no changes to file types or shortcuts
segment.target: (0x3) – “NoChange” - make no changes to file types or shortcuts

segment.source: ShortcutPolicy
segment.target: ShortcutPolicy

segment.source: DWORD
segment.target: DWORD

segment.source: Default=0x2
segment.target: Default=0x2

segment.source: (0x0) – “ClientOnly”- remove any existing items from the same publishing information source, and keep only items added locally
segment.target: (0x0) – “ClientOnly”- remove any existing items from the same publishing information source, and keep only items added locally

segment.source: (0x1) – “ServerOnly” - remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source and any items added locally, and add the new items
segment.target: (0x1) – “ServerOnly” - remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source and any items added locally, and add the new items

segment.source: (0x2) – “ClientAndServer”- remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source, keep items added locally, and add the new items (default if not present)
segment.target: (0x2) – “ClientAndServer”- remove any outdated items from the same publishing information source, keep items added locally, and add the new items (default if not present)

segment.source: (0x3) – “NoChange” - make no changes to file types or shortcuts
segment.target: (0x3) – “NoChange” - make no changes to file types or shortcuts

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The text values refer to the values for the XML attributes in the publishing XML file.
segment.target: The text values refer to the values for the XML attributes in the publishing XML file.

segment.source: You can set these values manually if you have implemented a custom HTTP publishing solution.
segment.target: You can set these values manually if you have implemented a custom HTTP publishing solution.
